b: ^the art for the cat enemy is broken

^the rat enemy dies in one hit

^The designer adjusts the rat's health upwards. Hopefully that fixes the problem.
^The designer adjusts the tutorial level's portal. Hopefully that fixes the problem.
^The audio designer adjusts the spatialization properties on the sword swing and all is fixed.
^Weirdly, the visual effect was tied to the sound effect somehow. Once the audio designer makes the sound play correctly, it'll be fixed.
^The sound designer made the sound play correctly, but it wasn't hooked up in the game's data files. The designer goes and fixes that.
^The artist does some tweaks to the wood floor texture. Hopefully that fixes the problem.
^For some reason the background art was tied to the audio? Who knows why. You track down the problem and the audio designer gets a fix in.

crash_bug: ^QA has found a crash while playing through the game. The crash occurred while they were
^Tracking down the cause of a crash can be somewhat difficult. There's a few approaches you can use to try to debug it. You might be able to solve it with one, or you might have to try all three.

crash_choices: ^Use the replay file to see where the crash occurred.
^Open the crash dump to figure out what line of code the crash occurred.
^Try the reproduction steps to see if the crash happens for you.
^You've run out of things to try.

c-3: ^ time on this crash. You mark it as won't fix and move on.
c-4: ^You tried everything you could, but sometimes a crash simply can't be fixed until you get more data. What a waste.

use_replay: ^To get data from the replay, you must do the following in order:
^1. Find the version of the game where the crash occurred
^2. Check out that version of the game from source control
^5. Play the replay back until the last frame
^This will give you a hint on where the crash is. Each of these steps will take a few minutes.

Day_1: ^You wake up to your alarm. It is
^ on Tuesday, the 10th of October. The game you have been working on for three years, Dog with a Sword, is releasing on Friday - in three days.
^How are you feeling about the release of Dog with a Sword?

c-0: ^Naturally, you are feeling anxious about the release. You've been working on Dog with a Sword for three years. The public will see it for the first time in just three days. You're looking forward to sharing it with everyone, but you don't know how it will be received.
^The anxiousness makes you get out of bed.
c-1: ^You're quite excited to share what you've got with the world. You think the game is in a great shape, and you're confident that the public will receive the game well.
^You get out of bed feeling energized and ready to get to work.

Day_1_Lunch: ^There isn't any set time for lunch at the office, but when one person gets up and starts eating, that's the tacit signal for everyone to go get food and gather around the office's common table.

^You and your coworkers don't have a whole lot in common, but that's okay. You all usually find something to talk about. The topics range from the shows folks are watching to the games people are playing to the current events of the day.

^Today, everyone is talking about the layoffs that are happening all around the game industry. A local studio has just laid off a ton of their staff. It's a studio that seemed completely stable from the outside, so it comes as a shock to everyone.
^You feel sorry for the developers who were affected.
^You wonder how long until it affects you.
^You're just glad it didn't happen to you.

c-0: ^Layoffs are terribly rough. You know from experience. You feel for those who were affected, and hope they find work soon.
c-1: ^You sit, disquieted. Layoffs are more and more common across the industry. How long until the layoffs come to affect you?
c-2: ^You look on the bright side. You're here, working on Dog with a Sword, a game that's about to release. That must count for something.
g-1: ^You finish up your food. You're a little worried, no doubt, but you still have a game to finish.
^Before everyone gets back to work, the creative director reminds everyone about the launch party on Thursday, two days from now.
g-2: ^, when you will go home, to get as much work done as you can. There are

Day_1_End: ^. Time to head home. You know you could work more, but your company has a no-crunch policy, and honestly, you're thankful for it. It stops you from giving in to your worse instincts.
^You walk to the bus stop. The bus is a little late, so you wait at the stop for a few minutes until it arrives. This is normal; the buses in your city aren't very frequent.
^When you get home, you greet your partner with a kiss. They tell you a bit about their day. It sounds like it was stressful.
^The two of you prepare dinner. You tell them about your day:
^There are way too many bugs left in the project.
^You're worried about how the game will be received.
^Everyone is excited to get the game out.
^Keep it short. You're tired from work.

Launch_Party: ^. It is time to head to the launch party.

g-0: ^The launch party is at a small event space in downtown. You and your partner arrive a little late, as is right for parties.
^The space is crowded. Everyone on the team, even those from far out of town, have made it. Most have brought a +1 - a partner, or just a friend - to celebrate with them.

c-1: ^You're excited. It's awesome that everyone managed to get together to celebrate before the launch. You're sure this will be a night to remember.
c-2: ^You feel a little overwhelmed. There are a lot of people here, and it's hard to know how to behave. This is your first real launch, after all.

g-1: ^Your partner notices, and she pushes you to go talk to some people. She can handle herself.

c-3: ^You go talk to your producer. They are here with their partner.
^It's been a particularly challening project for the producer because the team is very small and scrappy. It's been difficult to enforce any kind of structure on the team.

^As you chat with the producer, you move into topics that aren't about the game. You learn that they've also been going through a tough time at home. One of their relatives is moving in with them, and it's been difficult enforcing boundaries in their life.
^You had no idea that they were going through this. You sympathize with them, though they brush it off.
c-4: ^You catch one of the engineers. They're here with a mutual friend of yours.
^The friend congratulates you on release. "It must be a big deal for you, eh?"

c-0: ^You agree. It is a big deal. It's got you nervous and excited, all at once. And it's very cool to be celebrating here, with all of these people.
c-1: ^Actually, it's strange. Now that you're getting this close to release, the stress is falling away. There's not much that can be done. All that's left is to enjoy the party, and be in the moment.

c-5: ^You chat with a designer on the project. They laugh and apologize for all the localization bugs that you had to fix because of them.

^The designer has mixed feelings on the project. They're happy that it's releasing, but know that if the game had been scoped down some, it could have been in a much more polished state than it is now. They regret not pushing harder for more a more focused feature set.
^Ah, well, they muse. It's all in the past now. The game will release, and it will do as it does.

g-2: ^Suddenly, there is a small clamour at the front of the room.
^Look up at the front. What's happening?
g-3: ^"Speech!" They're chanting. The creative director is up there, looking a little embarrased. Everyone turns towards him, and he clears his throat.
^"Kind of hard to believe this is real, after four and a half years," he says. "We've finally made it. We're finally going to release Dog with a Sword."
^The room cheers. Your partner squeezes your hand. You poured a lot of work into Dog with a Sword, and she's seen the stress you've gone through.
^"And it's all thanks to you!" He gestures to the room. "You all made this possible. I couldn't have imagined making this game with another team."
g-4: ^Everyone's put forward their best work for the project. You're incredibly proud of the work you've done for Dog with a Sword, and it's been a hugely cool project to be a part of.

^"You know, it's kind of surreal, to be here, after all that happened to us." The creative director shakes his head. "The pandemic nearly ended the project. And it's kind of like we're making games at the end of the world, what with climate change, and... all of the rest of what's happening. It's weird."

c-10: ^"The game releases tomorrow, so celebrate! Drink up! A toast to all of you." He raises his glass, and everyone in the room does the same. "To Dog with a Sword!"
^"To Dog with a Sword!" Everyone toasts.

g-5: ^Sometime later, late at night, you head home from the party. You kiss your partner goodnight.

GameLaunch: ^It is 10AM on Friday, the 13th of October. The game you have been working on for three years, Dog with a Sword, is releasing today.

g-0: ^The air in the office crackles with excitement as your coworkers gather around.
^This is the culmination of years of work for the entire team.
g-1: ^Everyone is proud of what they have done. You are proud of what you have accomplished.
^You watch as your creative director pushes the go-live button.
g-2: ^The creative director pushes the button. A collectively held breath is released as the game you have been working on for three years is published.
^You experience a rush of good feelings.

c-3: ^Congratulations! Dog with a Sword has come out.

s: ^Meanwhile, the death toll in Palestine has reached over 10000.
^Journalists are killed for showing the truth.

g-8: ^Can we do what we love while ignoring evil?

c-9: ^Later that weekend, after the release, you have a call with your activist friend about the Palestinian massacre. They point you to some resources on what you can do to help.

call_to_action: ^Call your US state representatives and support a ceasefire.
^Donate to organizations sending aid to Palestine.

c-10: ^If you are not in the US, please call any relevant government representative.
c-11: ^Donate as much or as little as you can give. Every amount helps.

g-9: ^You feel a little better about the whole thing. It's the least you can do.

c-14: ^This is a piece of interactive fiction by Edward Lu.

^Deepest appreciation to all the brave civilian journalists, Palestinian press, and translators who produced the content used in this piece. You guided my hand. I have no words for the bravery I saw in your videos.

g-11: ^Clicking this will quit the game. Thank you for playing.

common_bus_ride: ^Sit near the front of the bus.
^Sit near the back of the bus.

c-0: ^You sit down near the front of the bus.
c-1: ^You sit down at the back of the bus.

s0: ^You pull a book out that you got at the library the other day. You lose yourself in the book until you get off the bus.
s1: ^You continue where you left off in the book. It's very engrossing.
s2: ^You continue where you left off. You're having trouble concentrating this time, but you get through as much as you can.
s3: ^You continue where you left off. You really like this book.
s4: ^You continue where you left off. Time passes quickly until you get off the bus.

s0: ^You pull out your earbuds and open up a podcast about an interesting topic. You learn about a new cool topic until you get off the bus.
s1: ^You listen to the next episode in the podcast. You can feel your brain expanding.
s2: ^You listen to the next episode in the podcast. You really like the voice of the guest speaker they brought on for this episode.
s3: ^You listen to the next episode in the podcast. You wonder what it would be like to start a podcast.
s4: ^You listen to the next episode in the podcast. Time passes quickly until you get off the bus.

c-4: ^You watch the blur outside the window for the duration of the ride. Only you know what went on in your brain.

s0: ^You kiss your partner. They are still sleeping, but they murmur something indistinct.
s1: ^Your partner has already awoken before you. They are feeding the cat. You interrupt them and give them a big kiss. They laugh in delight.
s2: ^Your partner is awake, but still in bed scrolling through videos on social media. You kiss them, and they throw their arms about you. "See you at the launch party later tonight," they say. You nod.

s0: ^There are a lot of tragic videos on your timeline, as, unfortunately, today not only marks three days until your release. It also marks three days since the start of the Israeli bombardment on Gaza, the latest episode in the ongoing Palestinian genocide. Twitter is filled with posts from all sorts people denouncing the massacre.
s1: ^The Palestinian massacre continues, and your timeline is filled with videos of folks protesting in person.
s2: ^The Palestinian massacre continues. Your timeline is filled with videos of the most recent hospital that was bombed by Israel.

c-1: ^Retweet some of the people supporting Palestinians.
^Ignore the Palestinian posts. You support Israel.
^Scroll down, looking for a tweet about Dog with a Sword.

s0: ^You retweet a gamedev personality who is quote-tweeting a post in support of Palestine.
s1: ^You retweet a video of protesters interrupting a senate hearing, holding up bloody hands.
s2: ^You retweet a video of a man standing on the rubble of his home, searching for his kids.

c-0: ^ You feel a little better about the whole thing. It's the least you can do.

s0: ^You find a tweet from your publisher about Dog with a Sword. It's got a hundred retweets! Promising. You retweet it.
s1: ^You find a tweet from your community manager. It has a reference to the Shadow Doggo Money Gang meme. Wow, three hundred likes! You like the tweet, and show it to your partner, who chuckles.
s2: ^You find a tweet about the impending release, and quote tweet it, adding that you're proud of the work you've done on the game. You sigh, putting your phone down. You really hope people like the game.

c-3: ^You put your phone in your pocket. The genocide continues anyway.

s2: ^You muse about Dog with a Sword's launch as you brush.

s0: ^Need to fuel up for the day.
s1: ^Breakfast may not be the most important meal of the day, but it is important.
s2: ^Gotta get energy for the last day before launch.

c-4: ^You put on a jacket and head out the door. You walk down the street to your bus.

s0: ^Fortunately, you were right on time today, and the bus is at the stop almost exactly when you get there. You feel happy about this.
s1: ^Unfortunately, as you're walking down the street, the bus zooms by. You sigh. You get to the stop, and wait for about ten minutes for the next bus. You tap your foot impatiently, but there's nothing to be done.
s2: ^You get to the bus stop and wait. You muse about how Dog with a Sword's might get received. You can tell you've been thinking about the game a lot today, which you suppose is natural, since the game is about to release. The bus arrives a few minutes later.

c-0: ^You pull up a teen drama. It's about a kid at school who gives out sex advice to fellow high-schoolers. In this episode, he gets into a fight with his girlfriend over an issue with their sex life that they can't resolve. How ironic.
c-1: ^You pull up a cartoon. It's a satire on adventure shows. It stars a duo of hapless teenagers who go on adventures, but can never quite get it right. In this episode, their father almost turns into a giant bug, and they fumble around for a cure until he gets cured by someone else. It gets a few chuckles out of you.
c-2: ^You pull up a baking show. It's a competition where the best amateur bakers in the UK try to win a grand prize.

b: ^Hearing your coworkers talk about the show piqued your interest.
^You've been following this show for a few weeks, and it's always fun to pick a favorite and see how they do.

c-2: ^ This week, the theme is bread. In a twist, one of the bakers falls ill, and no one is eliminated.

c-0: ^You head to the computer and open up a video game.

b: ^ Your partner hangs out nearby, and makes funny comments about the game over your shoulder.

c-0: ^ You play it for a few hours until it's bedtime.
c-1: ^You open up Youtube on the TV and spend time on the couch flicking through videos for a few hours.

b: ^ Your partner joins you, snuggling up under a blanket.

c-1: ^ You stay there until it's bedtime.
c-2: ^You sit down with your instrument and practice for a little while.

b: ^ Your partner hangs out, and doesn't say too much since she knows you're concentrating, but you enjoy her presence nonetheless.

c-3: ^You snuggle with your partner. Then you do some other physical things until it's bedtime.
